HABIT
  • 命令行接口 (CLI)
  • 查看页面源码

命令行接口 (CLI)

HABIT 的所有功能都可以通过 habit 命令行工具访问。 以下文档由代码自动生成，确保始终与最新版本保持同步。

habit

HABIT - Habitat Analysis: Biomedical Imaging Toolkit

A comprehensive toolkit for medical image analysis including: - Image preprocessing - Habitat analysis and clustering - Feature extraction - Machine learning modeling - Statistical analysis

habit [OPTIONS] COMMAND [ARGS]...

Options

--version

Show the version and exit.

compare

Generate model comparison plots and statistics

habit compare [OPTIONS]

Options

-c, --config <config>

Required Path to configuration YAML file

cv

Run K-fold cross-validation for model evaluation

habit cv [OPTIONS]

Options

-c, --config <config>

Required Path to configuration YAML file

dice

Calculate Dice coefficient between two batches of images

habit dice [OPTIONS]

Options

--input1 <input1>

Required Path to first batch (root directory or config file)

--input2 <input2>

Required Path to second batch (root directory or config file)

--output <output>

Path to save results CSV

Default:

'dice_results.csv'

--mask-keyword <mask_keyword>

Keyword for mask folder (used if input is a directory)

Default:

'masks'

--label-id <label_id>

Label ID to calculate Dice for

Default:

1

dicom-info

Extract and view DICOM file information

habit dicom-info [OPTIONS]

Options

-i, --input <input>

Required Path to DICOM directory, file, or YAML config file

-t, --tags <tags>

Comma-separated list of DICOM tags to extract (e.g., “PatientName,StudyDate,Modality”)

-o, --output <output>

Path to save results (CSV, Excel, or JSON)

-f, --format <format>

Output format for saved results

Default:

'csv'

Options:

csv | excel | json

--recursive, --no-recursive

Search recursively in subdirectories

Default:

True

--list-tags

List available tags instead of extracting information

--num-samples <num_samples>

Number of files to sample when listing tags

Default:

1

--group-by-series, --no-group-by-series

Group files by SeriesInstanceUID and only read one file per series. If disabled, read all files individually.

Default:

True

--one-file-per-folder

Only read one DICOM file per folder to speed up scanning. Useful when each folder contains exactly one series.

--dicom-extensions <dicom_extensions>

Comma-separated list of DICOM file extensions to recognize (e.g., “.dcm,.dicom,.ima”). Only used with –one-file-per-folder. Default: .dcm,.dicom

--include-no-extension

Also check files without extensions by reading DICOM magic bytes. Only used with –one-file-per-folder. Useful for some medical devices that produce DICOM files without file extensions.

-j, --num-workers <num_workers>

Number of worker threads for parallel processing. Default: min(32, cpu_count + 4). Set to 1 to disable parallelism.

-d, --max-depth <max_depth>

Maximum recursion depth for directory traversal. Only used with –one-file-per-folder. 0=root only, 1=root+1 level, etc. Default: unlimited. Example: For DICOM structure patient/study/series/, use -d 3

extract

Extract habitat features from clustered images

habit extract [OPTIONS]

Options

-c, --config <config>

Path to configuration YAML file

get-habitat

Generate habitat maps from medical images

habit get-habitat [OPTIONS]

Options

-c, --config <config>

Path to configuration YAML file

-m, --mode <mode>

Override run mode in the YAML (train or predict)

Options:

train | predict

--pipeline <pipeline>

Override pipeline path for predict mode

--debug

Enable debug mode

icc

Perform ICC (Intraclass Correlation Coefficient) analysis

habit icc [OPTIONS]

Options

-c, --config <config>

Required Path to configuration YAML file

merge-csv

Merge multiple CSV/Excel files horizontally based on index column.

INPUT_FILES: Two or more CSV/Excel files to merge
Examples:
# Same index column for all files
habit merge-csv file1.csv file2.csv -o merged.csv –index-col subject_id

# Different index column for each file habit merge-csv a.csv b.csv -o merged.csv –index-col “PatientID,subject_id”

# Use first column as index (default) habit merge-csv file1.csv file2.csv -o merged.csv

habit merge-csv [OPTIONS] INPUT_FILES...

Options

-o, --output <output>

Required Path for the output merged CSV file

-c, --index-col <index_col>

Index column name(s). Can be: single name for all files, or comma-separated names (one per file). Example: “id” or “PatientID,subject_id”

--separator <separator>

CSV separator character

Default:

','

--encoding <encoding>

File encoding

Default:

'utf-8'

--join <join_type>

Join type: inner (only common rows) or outer (all rows)

Default:

'inner'

Options:

inner | outer

Arguments

INPUT_FILES

Required argument(s)

model

Train or predict using machine learning models.

All parameters (including model path, data path, output directory) must be specified in the configuration file.

habit model [OPTIONS]

Options

-c, --config <config>

Required Path to configuration YAML file

-m, --mode <mode>

Operation mode: train or predict

Options:

train | predict

preprocess

Preprocess medical images (resampling, registration, normalization)

habit preprocess [OPTIONS]

Options

-c, --config <config>

Path to configuration YAML file

radiomics

Extract traditional radiomics features

habit radiomics [OPTIONS]

Options

-c, --config <config>

Path to configuration YAML file

retest

Perform test-retest reproducibility analysis

habit retest [OPTIONS]

Options

-c, --config <config>

Path to configuration YAML file
